item.title: In The Darkest Corner of Being
item.description: For the most part of my life (which is not very long), death is rarely mentioned on a casual occasion. It’s a sensitive topic, a rude one perhaps. It is the beast, cuffed and caged, thrown into the basement of a castle where tales become myths and rumours. It’s the alligator in the sewer about whom people talk in the death of the night, when they feel the craving for horror, just to simply let the stories slide with “Why would I ever go to the sewer?
